data.quote: If you believe in what you do and you really want to be in music, just stick at it. It's always a learning process. Enjoy it because I think making music is a privilege, really. In an ideal world, it should also always be fun. As much as possible, make it fun.

data.quote: We are approaching a new age of synthesis. Knowledge cannot be merely a degree or a skill... it demands a broader vision, capabilities in critical thinking and logical deduction without which we cannot have constructive progress.
data.author: Li Ka-shing

data.quote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
data.author: Kurt Vonnegut

data.quote: I will never be an old man. To me, old age is always 15 years older than I am.
data.author: Francis Bacon

data.quote: When marrying, ask yourself this question: Do you believe that you will be able to converse well with this person into your old age? Everything else in marriage is transitory.
data.author: Friedrich Nietzsche

data.quote: In age of consumerism and materialism, I traffic in blue sky and colored air.
data.author: James Turrell

data.quote: People gossip. People are insecure, so they talk about other people so that they won't be talked about. They point out flaws in other people to make them feel good about themselves. I think at any age or any social class, that's present.
data.author: Blake Lively

data.quote: The ruling ideas of each age have ever been the ideas of its ruling class.
data.author: Karl Marx

data.quote: No economy can succeed without a high-quality workforce, particularly in an age of globalization and technical change.
data.author: Ben Bernanke

data.quote: Youth is a blunder; Manhood a struggle, Old Age a regret.
data.author: Benjamin Disraeli

data.quote: My love for ice cream emerged at an early age - and has never left!
data.author: Ginger Rogers

data.quote: I strive for perfection, but I'm not perfect. But what I can say is my morals are totally different than any other 24-year-old rapper my age now. I look at life totally different. A whole other aspect. I have different views and morals on life in general. And opinions.
data.author: ASAP Rocky

data.quote: What though youth gave love and roses, Age still leaves us friends and wine.
data.author: Thomas Moore

data.quote: Every great architect is - necessarily - a great poet. He must be a great original interpreter of his time, his day, his age.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: In youth we learn in age we understand.
data.author: Marie von Ebner-Eschenbach

data.quote: Probably the happiest period in life most frequently is in middle age, when the eager passions of youth are cooled, and the infirmities of age not yet begun; as we see that the shadows, which are at morning and evening so large, almost entirely disappear at midday.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: Sometimes, people can be extraordinarily judgmental and closed-minded to anyone different or special, which is why it's so hard for young people in this day and age to be comfortable enough in their own skin to not listen to the people picking on them.
data.author: Ariana Grande

data.quote: 'Age' is the acceptance of a term of years. But maturity is the glory of years.
data.author: Martha Graham

data.quote: Old age and treachery will always beat youth and exuberance.
data.author: David Mamet

data.quote: Hesitation increases in relation to risk in equal proportion to age.
data.author: Ernest Hemingway

data.quote: In an age where everything and everyone is linked through networks of glass and air, no one - no business, organization, government agency, country - is an island. We need to do right by all our stakeholders, and that's how you create value for shareholders. And one thing is for sure - no organization can succeed in a world that is failing.
data.author: Don Tapscott

data.quote: I'm glad I was born when I was. My time was the golden age of variety. If I were starting out again now, maybe things would happen for me, but it certainly would not be on a variety show with 28 musicians, 12 dancers, two major guest stars, 50 costumes a week by Bob Mackie. The networks just wouldn't spend the money today.
data.author: Carol Burnett

data.quote: As I grow older, I pay less attention to what men say. I just watch what they do.
data.author: Andrew Carnegie

data.quote: Responsibility for learning belongs to the student, regardless of age.
data.author: Robert Martin

data.quote: Old age is no place for sissies.
data.author: Bette Davis

data.quote: When grace is joined with wrinkles, it is adorable. There is an unspeakable dawn in happy old age.
data.author: Victor Hugo

data.quote: My mother is Turtle Mountain Chippewa, and she lived on her home reservation. My father taught there. He had just been discharged from the Air Force. He went to school on the GI Bill and got his teaching credentials. He is adventurous - he worked his way through Alaska at age seventeen and paid for his living expenses by winning at the poker table.
data.author: Louise Erdrich

data.quote: We live in an age where there is a firehose of information, and there is no hierarchy of what is important and what is not. Where the truth is often fashioned through a variety of digital means. Are you your avatar? Who are you in social media? What face do you turn toward the world? How much does it have in common with who you actually are?
data.author: David Carr

data.quote: Education is the best provision for old age.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Be eccentric now. Don't wait for old age to wear purple.
data.author: Regina Brett

data.quote: There is no longer a doubt that women are just as competent as men. Gender differences are guided by nurture, as society treats boys and girls differently from an early age.
data.author: Naveen Jain

data.quote: There's a vintage which comes with age and experience.
data.author: Jon Bon Jovi

data.quote: With age comes the understanding and appreciation of your most important asset, your health.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: If you live to be one hundred, you've got it made. Very few people die past that age.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: Adults are obsolete children.
data.author: Dr. Seuss

data.quote: I conclude, therefore, that this star is not some kind of comet or a fiery meteor... but that it is a star shining in the firmament itself one that has never previously been seen before our time, in any age since the beginning of the world.
data.author: Tycho Brahe

data.quote: The trick is growing up without growing old.
data.author: Casey Stengel

data.quote: A comfortable old age is the reward of a well-spent youth. Instead of its bringing sad and melancholy prospects of decay, it would give us hopes of eternal youth in a better world.

data.quote: Old age, believe me, is a good and pleasant thing. It is true you are gently shouldered off the stage, but then you are given such a comfortable front stall as spectator.

data.quote: If you haven't turned rebel by twenty you've got no heart if you haven't turned establishment by thirty you've got no brains!
data.author: Kevin Spacey

data.quote: The finest lesson I've learned with age is that all I need is a small team of comrades who inspire me, try not to judge me, and remind me when I'm judging myself.

data.quote: Lack of education, old age, bad health or discrimination - these are causes of poverty, and the way to attack it is to go to the root.
data.author: Robert Kennedy

data.quote: I'm very mature for my age, but I'm also innocent in a lot of ways.
data.author: Kirsten Dunst

data.quote: Like a lot of kids, I had a Superman cake or different theme cakes, but then I hit the age where I think my mom thought I was ready for the German chocolate cake that she makes for my dad. data.author: Willie Geist

data.quote: In every age 'the good old days' were a myth. No one ever thought they were good at the time. For every age has consisted of crises that seemed intolerable to the people who lived through them.

data.quote: Age is whatever you think it is. You are as old as you think you are.
data.author: Muhammad Ali

data.quote: People say women shouldn't have long hair over a certain age, but I've never done what everyone says.
data.author: Jane Seymour

data.quote: You can wear black at any time. You can wear it at any age. You may wear it for almost any occasion a 'little black frock' is essential to a woman's wardrobe.
data.author: Christian Dior

data.quote: I'm happy to report that my inner child is still ageless.
data.author: James Broughton

data.quote: When granted many years of life, growing old in age is natural, but growing old with grace is a choice. Growing older with grace is possible for all who will set their hearts and minds on the Giver of grace, the Lord Jesus Christ.
data.author: Billy Graham

data.quote: It is true that going out on to the street implies the risk of accidents happening, as they would to any ordinary man or woman. But if the church stays wrapped up in itself, it will age. And if I had to choose between a wounded church that goes out on to the streets and a sick, withdrawn church, I would definitely choose the first one.
data.author: Pope Francis

data.quote: Youth is the best time to be rich, and the best time to be poor.
data.author: Euripides

data.quote: At the age of 18, I made up my mind to never have another bad day in my life. I dove into a endless sea of gratitude from which I've never emerged.

data.quote: Looking back, I realise I had to grow up and be responsible at a very tender age.
data.author: Andie MacDowell

data.quote: Thirty was so strange for me. I've really had to come to terms with the fact that I am now a walking and talking adult.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: At my age flowers scare me.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: My justification is that most people my age spend a lot of time thinking about what they're going to do for the next five or ten years. The time they spend thinking about their life, I just spend drinking.
data.author: Amy Winehouse

data.quote: It is not the young people that degenerate they are not spoiled till those of mature age are already sunk into corruption.
data.author: Charles de Montesquieu

data.quote: We all grow up. Hopefully, we get wiser. Age brings wisdom, and fatherhood changes one's life completely.
data.author: Frank Abagnale

data.quote: The golden age is before us, not behind us.
data.author: Simon the Zealot

data.quote: In the information age, you don't teach philosophy as they did after feudalism. You perform it. If Aristotle were alive today he'd have a talk show.

data.quote: Utility is the great idol of the age, to which all powers must do service and all talents swear allegiance.
data.author: Friedrich Schiller

data.quote: As time goes by and you're getting older and stuff like that - getting older sucks. You know, I hear all this crap about, 'Oh, you can age with dignity.' Really?

data.quote: We aren't in an information age, we are in an entertainment age.
data.author: Tony Robbins

data.quote: Youth is the spirit of adventure and awakening. It is a time of physical emerging when the body attains the vigor and good health that may ignore the caution of temperance. Youth is a period of timelessness when the horizons of age seem too distant to be noticed.
data.author: Ezra Taft Benson

data.quote: Just as we reject racism, sexism, ageism, and heterosexism, we reject speciesism. The species of a sentient being is no more reason to deny the protection of this basic right than race, sex, age, or sexual orientation is a reason to deny membership in the human moral community to other humans.
data.author: Gary L. Francione

data.quote: Old age has its pleasures, which, though different, are not less than the pleasures of youth.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: If you age with somebody, you go through so many roles - you're lovers, friends, enemies, colleagues, strangers; you're brother and sister. That's what intimacy is, if you're with your soulmate.
data.author: Cate Blanchett

data.quote: Privacy is one of the biggest problems in this new electronic age.
data.author: Andy Grove

data.quote: Age is relative. Experience is relative. And I think often intensity is confused with maturity.
data.author: Laura Marling

data.quote: My father... removed from Kentucky to... Indiana, in my eighth year... It was a wild region, with many bears and other wild animals still in the woods. There I grew up... Of course when I came of age, I did not know much. Still somehow, I could read, write, and cipher... but that was all.
data.author: Abraham Lincoln

data.quote: There's something unique about the United States, a sense of individual rights and freedoms, and a sense of social and civic responsibility that we contributed to so much of the world. data.author: George Hickenlooper

data.quote: A woman has the age she deserves.
data.author: Coco Chanel

data.quote: When we looked at the life cycle in our 40s, we looked to old people for wisdom. At 80, though, we look at other 80-year-olds to see who got wise and who not. Lots of old people don't get wise, but you don't get wise unless you age.

data.quote: Scripture is filled with examples of men and women whom God used late in life, often with great impact - men and women who refused to use old age as an excuse to ignore what God wanted them to do.
data.author: Billy Graham

data.quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent that is to triumph over old age.

data.quote: Retirement at sixty-five is ridiculous. When I was sixty-five I still had pimples.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: We are always the same age inside.

data.quote: Irrespective of age, we mourn for those loved and lost. Mourning is one of the deepest expressions of pure love.
data.author: Russell M. Nelson

data.quote: It is surprising to notice that even from the earliest age, man finds the greatest satisfaction in feeling independent. The exalting feeling of being sufficient to oneself comes as a revelation.

data.quote: I had assumed that I would age with all my friends growing old around me, dying off very gradually one by one. And here was a plague that cut them off so early.
data.author: Thom Gunn

data.quote: By the proper intakes of vitamins and other nutrients and by following a few other healthful practices from youth or middle age on, you can, I believe, extend your life and years of well-being by twenty-five or even thirty-five years.

data.quote: I don't think of myself as a poor deprived ghetto girl who made good. I think of myself as somebody who from an early age knew I was responsible for myself, and I had to make good.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: Our age knows nothing but reaction, and leaps from one extreme to another.
data.author: Reinhold Niebuhr

data.quote: There are only three things that can kill a farmer: lightning, rolling over in a tractor, and old age.
data.author: Bill Bryson

data.quote: Even one voice can be heard loudly all over the world in this day and age.
data.author: Aung San Suu Kyi

data.quote: We live in the age of the refugee, the age of the exile.
data.author: Ariel Dorfman

data.quote: To resist the frigidity of old age, one must combine the body, the mind, and the heart. And to keep these in parallel vigor one must exercise, study, and love.

data.quote: Though the Jazz Age continued it became less and less an affair of youth. The sequel was like a children's party taken over by the elders.
data.author: F. Scott Fitzgerald

data.quote: I had just been promoted to the first rugby team. It was a perfect, wonderful coming of age. My brother was already in the team, and my father had come to watch us. We went home, and my father died in front of me. Horribly, in about half an hour. He had a heart attack.

data.quote: Old age is the most unexpected of all things that happen to a man.
data.author: Leon Trotsky

data.quote: Preparation for old age should begin not later than one's teens. A life which is empty of purpose until 65 will not suddenly become filled on retirement.
data.author: Dwight L. Moody

data.quote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
data.author: Lucille Ball

data.quote: Better pass boldly into that other world, in the full glory of some passion, than fade and wither dismally with age.

data.quote: New needs need new techniques. And the modern artists have found new ways and new means of making their statements... the modern painter cannot express this age, the airplane, the atom bomb, the radio, in the old forms of the Renaissance or of any other past culture.

data.quote: I have always felt that a woman has the right to treat the subject of her age with ambiguity until, perhaps, she passes into the realm of over ninety. Then it is better she be candid with herself and with the world.

data.quote: Discrimination due to age is one of the great tragedies of modern life. The desire to work and be useful is what makes life worth living, and to be told your efforts are not needed because you are the wrong age is a crime.

data.quote: You can fake your age or mask it, but the passion that moves the characters has to be real.
data.author: Victoria Abril

data.quote: Living life at a young age is like being a sponge thrust into the ocean. You absorb what's around you. If you're around people who are supportive and positive, that's how you look at the world.
data.author: Freddie Prinze, Jr.

data.quote: Alas, after a certain age every man is responsible for his face.
data.author: Albert Camus

data.quote: The great secret that all old people share is that you really haven't changed in seventy or eighty years. Your body changes, but you don't change at all. And that, of course, causes great confusion.

data.quote: Old age is like a plane flying through a storm. Once you're aboard, there's nothing you can do.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: Surrounding myself with beautiful women keeps me young.
data.author: Hugh Hefner

data.quote: In youth we run into difficulties. In old age difficulties run into us.
data.author: Josh Billings

data.quote: It is not how old you are, but how you are old.
data.author: Jules Renard

data.quote: In youth, the days are short and the years are long. In old age, the years are short and days long.
data.author: Pope Paul VI

data.quote: Nobody grows old merely by living a number of years. We grow old by deserting our ideals. Years may wrinkle the skin, but to give up enthusiasm wrinkles the soul.

data.quote: Jobs are a centuries-old concept created during the Industrial Revolution. Despite the reality that we're now deep in the Information Age, many people are studying for, or working at, or clinging to the Industrial Age idea of a safe, secure job.
data.author: Robert Kiyosaki

data.quote: Age is inevitable. Aging isn't.
data.author: Marv Levy

data.quote: Cancer cells are fixed at an age where they are still too young to have learned the rules of the society in which they live. data.author: Sherwin B. Nuland

data.quote: Age is no barrier. It's a limitation you put on your mind.

data.quote: The harvest of old age is the recollection and abundance of blessing previously secured.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: I'm at the age where food has taken the place of sex in my life. In fact, I've just had a mirror put over my kitchen table.

data.quote: Exposure from a young age to the realities of the world is a super-big thing.
data.author: Bill Gates

data.quote: We are all shaped by where we grow up, though that shaping takes different forms. I don't think there's any doubt that coming of age in Winnipeg both opened my eyes and made me hungry - if I can subvert all claims to be a real writer by mixing metaphors like that.

data.author: Joel Fuhrman

data.quote: The excitement of learning separates youth from old age. As long as you're learning you're not old.
data.author: Rosalyn S. Yalow

data.quote: I'm very pleased to be here. Let's face it, at my age I'm very pleased to be anywhere.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: What Youth deemed crystal, Age finds out was dew.
data.author: Robert Browning

data.quote: Each age has deemed the new-born year the fittest time for festal cheer.
data.author: Walter Scott

data.quote: The biggest disease this day and age is that of people feeling unloved.
data.author: Princess Diana

data.quote: Every age yearns for a more beautiful world. The deeper the desperation and the depression about the confusing present, the more intense that yearning.
data.author: Johan Huizinga

data.quote: Children who reach the age of eighteen with their entire skills set composed on Nintendo and eating Doritos have been neglected. Their parents neglected to give them the character traits necessary to live successfully.
data.author: Dave Ramsey

data.quote: People have to understand one thing: at the age of 18, I arrived at a dream club like Manchester United. It was a dream come true. data.author: Cristiano Ronaldo

data.quote: There's a lot of women out there, some of whom are my age who've never been married and some who have been married and would like to be married again but think their ship has sailed, and I'm like, 'Oh no, honey, let Miss Niecy show you it is never too late for love!'
data.author: Niecy Nash

data.quote: People don't understand being a child star is very hard because first off, to be a child star, you have to be very unique. These kids are talented to be able to do it at such a young age. At the same time, you go through the pressures of bullying and a lot of people not understanding.
data.author: Romeo Miller

data.quote: At an early age, my mother gave me this feeling that anything is possible, and I believe that.
data.author: Howard Schultz

data.quote: At some point in every person's life, you will need an assisted medical device - whether it's your glasses, your contacts, or as you age and you have a hip replacement or a knee replacement or a pacemaker. The prosthetic generation is all around us.
data.author: Aimee Mullins

data.quote: We live in an age when the traditional great subjects - the human form, the landscape, even newer traditions such as abstract expressionism - are daily devalued by commercial art.
data.author: Andy Warhol

data.quote: For me at age 11, I had a pair of binoculars and looked up to the moon, and the moon wasn't just bigger, it was better. There were mountains and valleys and craters and shadows. And it came alive.
data.author: Neil deGrasse Tyson

data.quote: One of the things you learn in football is that you're only as good as your last outing. I don't like to reflect on what we've done in the past. I'm not a very good storyteller, for one thing. I'd disappoint you. When it's time, I'll talk about the good old days. But it's a sign of old age, reveling in the past.
data.author: Chuck Noll

data.quote: The thing I love most about my job is watching people age backward, becoming more lively and energetic as they free themselves from situations that are toxic to their essential selves.
data.author: Martha Beck

data.quote: Maybe women get to a certain age and they no longer have a filter they're considered crazy people or something.
data.author: Michaela Watkins

data.quote: We're in the age of the series, trilogy, boxed sets.
data.author: Glen Duncan

data.quote: I knew that I was loved. And that's such an important thing. And, of course, at such an early age, you take it for granted. Of course your parents love you. Of course Mrs. Hubert across the street loves you and your godmother loves you and your grandparents love you.
data.author: Jessye Norman

data.quote: Who would want a face that hasn't seen or lived properly, hasn't got any wrinkles that come with age, experience and laughter? Not me, anyway.
data.author: Cate Blanchett

data.quote: If repression has indeed been the fundamental link between power, knowledge, and sexuality since the classical age, it stands to reason that we will not be able to free ourselves from it except at a considerable cost.
data.author: Michel Foucault

data.quote: Every work of art is the child of its age and, in many cases, the mother of our emotions. It follows that each period of culture produces an art of its own which can never be repeated.
data.author: Wassily Kandinsky

data.quote: Anything you cannot relinquish when it has outlived its usefulness possesses you, and in this materialistic age a great many of us are possessed by our possessions.
data.author: Peace Pilgrim

data.quote: Basically, when I went to school in Sri Lanka from age five onward, the classes there were sometimes sorted into a hierarchy of your skin tone. So the fairer-skinned kids sat at the front row, and the darker-skinned kids sat at the back by the poor ones who played out in the street all day long.
data.author: M.I.A.

data.quote: What I believe about the young age of the earth comes out of taking the Bible as written. And I've said numerous times over the years that the age of the earth, for example, is not a salvation issue but an authority issue.
data.author: Ken Ham

data.quote: Whatever you may look like, marry a man your own age - as your beauty fades, so will his eyesight.
data.author: Phyllis Diller

data.quote: I don't feel old. I don't feel anything till noon. That's when it's time for my nap.
data.author: Bob Hope

data.quote: We're not in an information age anymore. We're in the information management age.
data.author: Chris Hardwick

data.quote: In my youth I stressed freedom, and in my old age I stress order. I have made the great discovery that liberty is a product of order.
data.author: Will Durant

data.quote: At twenty years of age the will reigns; at thirty, the wit; and at forty, the judgment.
data.author: Benjamin Franklin

data.quote: Bashfulness is an ornament to youth, but a reproach to old age.
data.author: Aristotle

data.quote: Old age has deformities enough of its own. It should never add to them the deformity of vice.
data.author: Eleanor Roosevelt

data.quote: A man growing old becomes a child again.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Whether you are just entering the workforce or nearing retirement age, planning for the future is critical.
data.author: Ron Lewis

data.quote: Youth is the time of getting, middle age of improving, and old age of spending.
data.author: Anne Bradstreet

data.quote: The most audacious thing I could possibly state in this day and age is that life is worth living. It's worth being bashed against. It's worth getting scarred by. It's worth pouring yourself over every one of its coals.
data.author: Jeff Buckley

data.quote: Bad news isn't wine. It doesn't improve with age.
data.author: Colin Powell

data.quote: My view is that at a younger age your optimism is more and you have more imagination etc. You have less bias.
data.author: A. P. J. Abdul Kalam

data.quote: We try, we fail, we posture, we aspire, we pontificate - and then we age, shrink, die, and vanish.
data.author: George Saunders

data.quote: Kids are naturally gifted at art from a very young age. The problem is when they get older and become self-conscious. The process should always be fun, though.
data.author: Damien Hirst

data.quote: In the U.S., the '50s and '60s marked the documentary's golden age, especially at CBS, where pioneering television journalist Edward R. Murrow, immortalised in George Clooney's 'Good Night, and Good Luck,' produced such landmark investigations as the CBS Reports programme 'Hunger in America.'
data.author: Naomi Wolf

data.quote: An age is called Dark not because the light fails to shine, but because people refuse to see it.
data.author: James A. Michener

data.quote: An archaeologist is the best husband a woman can have. The older she gets the more interested he is in her.
data.author: Agatha Christie

data.quote: The surest sign of age is loneliness.
data.author: Annie Dillard

data.quote: To me, old age is always fifteen years older than I am.
data.author: Bernard Baruch

data.quote: Old age comes on suddenly, and not gradually as is thought.
data.author: Emily Dickinson

data.quote: There's no such thing as old age, there is only sorrow.
data.author: Fay Weldon

data.quote: Every man desires to live long, but no man wishes to be old.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: One of the many pleasures of old age is giving things up.
data.author: Malcolm Muggeridge

data.quote: As long as any adult thinks that he, like the parents and teachers of old, can become introspective, invoking his own youth to understand the youth before him, he is lost.
data.author: Margaret Mead

data.quote: Whatever poet, orator or sage may say of it, old age is still old age.
data.author: Sinclair Lewis

data.quote: Let age, not envy, draw wrinkles on thy cheeks.
data.author: Thomas Browne

data.quote: I don't believe one grows older. I think that what happens early on in life is that at a certain age one stands still and stagnates.
data.author: T. S. Eliot

data.quote: To keep the heart unwrinkled, to be hopeful, kindly, cheerful, reverent - that is to triumph over old age.
data.author: Thomas Bailey Aldrich

data.quote: Age is not important unless you're a cheese.
data.author: Helen Hayes

data.quote: I think women should start to embrace their age. What's the alternative to getting older? You die. I can't change the day I was born. But I can take care of my skin, my body, my mind, and try to live my life and be happy.
data.author: Olivia Munn

data.quote: We've put more effort into helping folks reach old age than into helping them enjoy it.
data.author: Frank A. Clark

data.quote: Whenever I go to New York or any European country, they say: 'Nawal, why don't you get a facelift?' I tell them, 'I am proud of my wrinkles. Every wrinkle on my face tells the story of my life. Why should I hide my age?'
data.author: Nawal El Saadawi

data.quote: Stone Age. Bronze Age. Iron Age. We define entire epics of humanity by the technology they use.
data.author: Reed Hastings

data.quote: No sociologist should think himself too good, even in his old age, to make tens of thousands of quite trivial computations in his head and perhaps for months at a time.
data.author: Max Weber

data.quote: I think the thing I miss most in our age is our manners. It sounds so old-fashioned in a way. But even bad people had good manners in the old days, and manners hold a community together, and manners hold a family together; in a way, they hold the world together.
data.author: Nancy Friday

data.quote: I think the biggest disease the world suffers from in this day and age is the disease of people feeling unloved. I know that I can give love for a minute, for half an hour, for a day, for a month, but I can give. I am very happy to do that, I want to do that.
data.author: Princess Diana

data.quote: Let no one be slow to seek wisdom when he is young nor weary in the search of it when he has grown old. For no age is too early or too late for the health of the soul.
data.author: Epicurus

data.quote: As technology advances, it reverses the characteristics of every situation again and again. The age of automation is going to be the age of 'do it yourself.'
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: I've always been intrigued by color and by interesting hair. I was one of those weird little girls doing my own hair at the age of 9. I was, like, getting weird gels and new brushes and cornrow holders. I would tweak and perm at the age of 13.
data.author: Nicki Minaj

data.quote: Being healthy is something I learned from a very young age. Looking after yourself on the inside helps with your energy, makes your skin glow, and changes your whole outlook on life.
data.author: Phoebe Tonkin

data.quote: Basically, when you get to my age, you'll really measure your success in life by how many of the people you want to have love you actually do love you.
data.author: Warren Buffett

data.quote: The nicest thing about coming of age is that I can do whatever I like.
data.author: Cilla Black

data.quote: Middle age is when your old classmates are so grey and wrinkled and bald they don't recognize you.
data.author: Bennett Cerf

data.quote: Most fears are basic: fear of the dark, fear of going down in the basement, fear of weird sounds, fear that somebody is waiting for you in your closet. Those kinds of things stay with you no matter what age.
data.author: R. L. Stine

data.quote: With age comes common sense and wisdom.
data.author: Nas

data.quote: Too many U.S. adults have a heart age years older than their real age, increasing their risk of heart disease and stroke. Everybody deserves to be young - or at least not old - at heart.
data.author: Tom Frieden

data.quote: It seems this is an age of clever critics who keep bewailing the fact that there are no works worthy of criticism.
data.author: Sylvia Plath

data.quote: Confusion of goals and perfection of means seems, in my opinion, to characterize our age.
data.author: Albert Einstein

data.quote: Of middle age the best that can be said is that a middle-aged person has likely learned how to have a little fun in spite of his troubles.
data.author: Don Marquis

data.quote: I have had so many great moments, but I would have to say that dancing the Swan in 'Swan Lake' was such a unique and passionate experience for me. It was such bloody hard work, even at that very early age, that I would not want to try to replicate it again now.
data.author: William Kempe

data.quote: Youth cannot know how age thinks and feels. But old men are guilty if they forget what it was to be young.
data.author: J. K. Rowling

data.quote: Leadership in telecommunications is also essential, since we are now in the age of e-commerce.
data.author: Michael Oxley

data.quote: Age is just a number. It's totally irrelevant unless, of course, you happen to be a bottle of wine.
data.author: Joan Collins

data.quote: You just never know when you're living in a golden age.
data.author: Alexander Payne

data.quote: Old age is a special problem for me because I've never been able to shed the mental image I have of myself - a lad of about 19.
data.author: E. B. White

data.quote: This might be the first generation where kids are dying at a younger age than their parents and it's related primarily to the obesity problem.
data.author: Judy Davis

data.quote: When I started go-karting at the age of six, I always dreamt of becoming a Formula One driver.
data.author: Heikki Kovalainen

data.quote: What's interesting about the shift from an industrial age to a technological age is that we keep inventing new media: movies, records, radio, television, the Internet, and now ebooks - and one of the things that's most interesting about the invention of a new medium is watching it reinvent itself as it penetrates the culture.
data.author: David Gerrold

data.quote: I've always been drawn to the Edwardian period in England. To me, it seems like such a fascinating time, when the British Empire was at the height of its powers and the strict mores of the Victorian age were dissipating into the decadence of King Edward's reign.
data.author: Kevin Kwan

data.quote: After 3 years, I left the army at the ripe old age of 20, but I'd like to think some of the skills are still with me. I'm great at physical movement; I can still remember Morse code, and perhaps most importantly, I can fold my socks up into little balls with smiley faces.
data.author: Rhys Darby

data.quote: Eighteenth-century doctors prescribed sugar pills for nearly everything: heart problems, headache, consumption, labor pains, insanity, old age, and blindness. Hence, the French expression 'like an apothecary without sugar' meant someone in an utterly hopeless situation.
data.author: Tom Reiss

data.quote: The charm of history and its enigmatic lesson consist in the fact that, from age to age, nothing changes and yet everything is completely different.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: The age of chivalry is past. Bores have succeeded to dragons.
data.author: Charles Dickens

data.quote: Age puzzles me. I thought it was a quiet time. My seventies were interesting and fairly serene, but my eighties are passionate. I grow more intense as I age.
data.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

data.quote: Books were my pass to personal freedom. I learned to read at age three, and soon discovered there was a whole world to conquer that went beyond our farm in Mississippi.
data.author: Oprah Winfrey

data.quote: I think age is a very high price to pay for maturity.
data.author: Tom Stoppard

data.quote: Any young man who is unmarried at the age of twenty one is a menace to the community.
data.author: Brigham Young

data.quote: But an old age serene and bright, and lovely as a Lapland night, shall lead thee to thy grave.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: This is the patent age of new inventions for killing bodies, and for saving souls. All propagated with the best intentions.
data.author: Lord Byron

data.quote: Middle Age is that perplexing time of life when we hear two voices calling us, one saying, 'Why not?' and the other, 'Why bother?'
data.author: Sydney J. Harris

data.quote: Old age is an insult. It's like being smacked.
data.author: Lawrence Durrell

data.quote: If the nineteenth century was the age of the editorial chair, ours is the century of the psychiatrist's couch.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: Age is not all decay; it is the ripening, the swelling, of the fresh life within, that withers and bursts the husk.
data.author: George MacDonald

data.quote: To teach how to live without certainty and yet without being paralysed by hesitation is perhaps the chief thing that philosophy, in our age, can do for those who study it.
data.author: Bertrand Russell

data.quote: Children also have artistic ability, and there is wisdom in there having it! The more helpless they are, the more instructive are the examples they furnish us; and they must be preserved free of corruption from an early age.
data.author: Paul Klee

data.quote: Every age has a keyhole to which its eye is pasted.
data.author: Mary McCarthy

data.quote: I knew at an early age I wanted to act. Acting was always easy for me. I don't believe in predestination, but I do believe that once you get where ever it is you are going, that is where you were going to be.

data.quote: Thomas Jefferson once said, 'We should never judge a president by his age, only by his works.' And ever since he told me that, I stopped worrying.
data.author: Ronald Reagan

data.quote: Each age tries to form its own conception of the past. Each age writes the history of the past anew with reference to the conditions uppermost in its own time.
data.author: Frederick Jackson Turner

data.quote: In every age there has been a stream of popular opinion that has carried all before it, and given a family character, as it were, to the century.
data.author: Mary Wollstonecraft

data.quote: I saw no African people in the printed and illustrated Sunday school lessons. I began to suspect at this early age that someone had distorted the image of my people. My long search for the true history of African people the world over began.

data.quote: It's trite to say that the world has gotten smaller in the age of globalization, but my travels have told me that it's wrong to think this means there is some kind of uniform world culture.
data.author: Norman Spinrad

data.quote: There's something intrinsically Australian about a bunch of brothers and school friends getting together as a band at a very young age and all pulling together as a band at a very young age and all pulling together as mates to make something happen.
data.author: Michael Hutchence

data.quote: According to the National Institute on Drug Abuse, the first use of alcohol typically begins at age 12.
data.author: Xavier Becerra

data.quote: Here's my Golden Rule for a tarnished age: Be fair with others, but keep after them until they're fair with you.
data.author: Alan Alda

data.quote: Old age: the crown of life, our play's last act.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: I think a child should be allowed to take his father's or mother's name at will on coming of age. Paternity is a legal fiction.
data.author: James Joyce

data.quote: People who refuse to rest honorably on their laurels when they reach retirement age seem very admirable to me.
data.author: Helen Hayes

data.quote: Man has no Body distinct from his Soul; for that called Body is a portion of Soul discerned by the five Senses, the chief inlets of Soul in this age.
data.author: William Blake

data.quote: Our Age of Anxiety is, in great part, the result of trying to do today's job with yesterday's tools and yesterday's concepts.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: O love, if I regret the age when one savors you, it is not for the hour of pleasure, but for the one that follows it.
data.author: Jean-Jacques Rousseau

data.quote: In this electronic age we see ourselves being translated more and more into the form of information, moving toward the technological extension of consciousness.
data.author: Marshall McLuhan

data.quote: Age is not measured by years. Nature does not equally distribute energy. Some people are born old and tired while others are going strong at seventy.
data.author: Dorothy Thompson

data.quote: I'm very accepting with my age. It's like notches on your belt: experience, wisdom, and a different kind of beauty. There comes a day when you've become comfortable in your skin.

data.quote: Losing both parents at a young age gave me a sense that you can't really control life - so you'd better live it while it's here. I stopped believing in a storybook existence a long time ago. All you can do is push in a direction and see what comes of it.
data.author: Jon Hamm

data.quote: Canada has a passive-aggressive culture, with a lot of sarcasm and righteousness. That went with my weird messianic complex. The ego is a fascinating monster. I was taught from a young age that I had to serve, so that turned into me thinking I had to save the planet.
data.author: Alanis Morissette

data.quote: It's the age of information and we need to just get as informed as we can about what other things might help us live healthy lives.
data.author: Linda Hamilton

data.quote: My dad just imprinted in my mind from a very young age that you always do what you say you're gonna do when you say you're gonna do it.
data.author: Bob Corker

data.quote: From an early age I didn't buy into the value systems of working hard in a nine-to-five job. I thought creativity, friendship and loyalty and pushing the boundaries of what was acceptable was much more interesting.

data.quote: At an early age, I started my own paper route. Once I saw how you could service people and do a good job and get paid for it, I just wanted to be the best I could be in whatever I did.

data.quote: I am happy being able to play roles with people my age because once you do something really mature there is no turning back.
data.author: Lindsay Lohan

data.quote: It's really amazing that in the age of unbelief, as a smart man called it, there isn't even more fraud. After all, with no God, there's no one to ever call you to account, and no accounting at all if you can get away with it.
data.author: Ben Stein

data.quote: It's sad, actually, because my anxiety keeps me from enjoying things as much as I should at this age.
data.author: Amanda Seyfried

data.quote: I feel the 21st century is another new age. Not only can we collaborate again with nature, but we have to. It's an emergency.

data.quote: With age, you see people fail more. You see yourself fail more. How do you keep that fearlessness of a kid? You keep going. Luckily, I'm not afraid to make a fool of myself.

data.quote: For the moment I prefer to be a beautiful woman of my age than try desperately to look 30.

data.quote: When at a young age you learn to face your fears, that makes the difference between people being champions and people not being champions.
data.author: Evander Holyfield

data.quote: Me personally, I want to entertain people above all. When you look back at burlesque in history and the real golden age of burlesque, those entertainers were there to entertain, and there wasn't usually some big political message behind what they were doing.

data.quote: It's rough being a teenager in this day and age.

data.quote: I used to help my grandfather on the farm, driving tractors, raising crops and animals. I used to feed some of the baby cows and pigs, and I had to be no older than 7 or 8. data.author: Tyson Chandler

data.quote: My children were taught at an early age how money works and that it comes from hard work. They've been on a commission - not an allowance - since they were little. They learned that if they worked around the house, they got paid. If they didn't work, they didn't get paid.
data.author: Dave Ramsey

data.quote: My father was a newspaper editor, so I was surrounded by journalists my entire life. I think the fact that he was so well known may be why I chose to go into magazines and move to the States at a young age.
data.author: Anna Wintour

data.quote: Even at age 10, I already knew that I was different from most people. My anxiety disorder was still years from being diagnosed, but it affected me quite deeply. I was too afraid to speak out in class, too nervous to make real friends.

data.quote: I am becoming more radical with age. I have noticed that writers, when they are old, become milder. But for me it is the opposite. Age makes me more angry.

data.quote: You know, from age 17 on, my paycheck was coming from cooking and working in kitchens.

data.quote: If anyone thinks they'd rather be in a different part of history, they're probably not a very good student of history. Life sucked in the old days. data.author: Elon Musk

data.quote: For me, the end of childhood came when the number of candles on my birthday cake no longer reflected my age, around 19 or 20. From then on, each candle came to represent an entire decade.
data.author: Yotam Ottolenghi

data.quote: There's a great deal to say in the Bible about the signs we're to watch for, and when these signs all converge at one place we can be sure that we're close to the end of the age.

data.quote: We always think, 'Well, for a person who's blind, it must be an amazing, joyful miracle if by some chance their sight is restored to them.' Now, this may be true for blind people who lost their vision at a later age. It's rarely true for people who were born blind or who go blind at a very young age.
data.author: Rosemary Mahoney

data.quote: At the age of nine, I could cross the length of Glasgow on a succession of buses, wearing regulation garter-topped stockings and compulsory cap and - if I'd done well enough to earn the honour in last week's test - with a First World War medal on a striped ribbon pinned to my brown blazer. I must have looked like a chocolate soldier.
data.author: Ronald Frame

data.quote: If the Age of Sport has been all champagne and roses hitherto, then expect our love affair with its newly-acquired prominence to become increasingly tainted by scandals about cheating. Sport is losing its shine and allure.

data.quote: We live in such an age of chatter and distraction. Everything is a challenge for the ears and eyes.
data.author: Rebecca Pidgeon

data.quote: I knew what I wanted to do in sport from the age of nine.
data.author: Magdalena Neuner

data.quote: I was born three weeks early, and I kept being ill. From the age of zero to four, I was always in hospital having tests done, but they couldn't find out what was wrong. They discovered that one of my kidneys wasn't working properly, and it had scarred. I had to have 32 injections in my arm in the morning and evening to try and make me better.

data.quote: I was already, I think, at the age of 18, showing signs of being incompetent in the lab.
data.author: Peter Higgs

data.quote: The last thing I wanted was to be with someone who's the same age as me and wanted the limelight, wanted the attention. There's lots of girls out there who do.
data.author: Gareth Gates

data.quote: As I'm traveling around, I meet many small children. And when I look at a small and think how we've harmed this beautiful planet since I was that age, I feel a kind of desperation, anger, shame. I don't know what I feel; I just don't know what the emotion is.

data.quote: Everyone is the sum total of past experiences. A character doesn't just spring to life at age thirty.

data.quote: My age has so little to do with my image of myself because at a certain point, the number just didn't fit how I felt. It has become irrelevant to me. I just don't feel like that number is representative of my spirit, of my energy or my anything!

data.quote: Regardless of your marital status, your age, or the language you speak, you are a beloved spirit daughter of Heavenly Father who is destined to play a critical part in the onward movement of the gospel kingdom.
data.author: Sheri L. Dew

data.quote: No matter what age you are, or what your circumstances might be, you are special, and you still have something unique to offer. Your life, because of who you are, has meaning.
data.author: Barbara De Angelis

data.quote: Age considers youth ventures.
data.author: Rabindranath Tagore

data.quote: Everyone talks about age, but it's not about age. It's about work ethic. Winning never gets old.

data.quote: In this new age of GPS, Google Earth and multidimensional digital maps, mapping is suddenly hugely relevant again.
data.author: Hans-Ulrich Obrist

data.quote: Age has given me the gift of me; it just gave me what I was always longing for, which was to get to be the woman I've already dreamt of being. Which is somebody who can do rest and do hard work and be a really constant companion, a constant, tender-hearted wife to myself.

data.quote: English people don't have very good diction. In France you have to pronounce very particularly and clearly, and learning French at an early age helped me enormously.

data.quote: People are looking to have more meaning in their lives. It is a sign the technology community is coming of age.

data.quote: Age does not protect you from love. But love, to some extent, protects you from age.

data.quote: Being young isn't about age, it's about being a free spirit. You can meet someone of 20 who's boring and old, or you can meet someone of 70 who's youthful and exciting. I met Fred Astaire when he was 72 and I was 21, and I fell in love with him. He certainly was a free spirit.
data.author: Twiggy

data.quote: The freethinking of one age is the common sense of the next.
data.author: Matthew Arnold

data.quote: Guitars have been the obsession of my life. I first picked one up at the age of four and I've been a guitar junkie ever since.
data.author: Johnny Marr

data.quote: I can't wait to be that age and hanging out with a bunch of people hanging out all day playing golf and going to the beach, all my own age. We'd be laughing and having a good time and getting loopy on our prescription drugs. Driving golf carts around. I can't wait.

data.quote: With age, you get to a place where you don't want to knock people out. You just want to give people a hug.

data.quote: Your grandparents came of age in the Great Depression, when everyday life was about deprivation and sacrifice, when the economic conditions of the time were so grave and so unrelenting it would have been easy enough for the American dream to fade away.

data.quote: The divine right of husbands, like the divine right of kings, may, it is hoped, in this enlightened age, be contested without danger.
data.author: Mary Wollstonecraft

data.quote: I must confess, I was born at a very early age.
data.author: Groucho Marx

data.quote: If you love someone, you love someone. It doesn't matter; age, colour, c'mon!
data.author: Sam Taylor-Johnson

data.quote: The irony is that the more we fight age, the more it shows. Paint on a 50-year-old face brings to mind a Gilbert and Sullivan comic figure. Smooth the cheeks, and suddenly the ear lobes and hands look out of place. Do we run around in October, painting the gold leaves green?

data.quote: Legend: A lie that has attained the dignity of age.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: Old age is just a record of one's whole life.

data.quote: I was five years old; I got addicted to being on stage. I felt like it was the most wonderful place on Earth, performing in front of an audience, who in this case were a bunch of classmates, kids my age.

data.quote: Millennials regularly draw ire for their cell phone usage. They're mobile natives, having come of age when landlines were well on their way out and payphones had gone the way of dinosaurs. Because of their native fluency, Millennials recognize mobile phones can do a whole lot more than make calls, enable texting between friends or tweeting.
data.author: Chelsea Clinton

data.quote: I don't know what's happened to me. I've got a bit more sophisticated in my old age. I like a bit of jasmine tea. I love it.

data.quote: From a young age, I was rubbing elbows with a very different kind of person and social class, and I felt a lot of tension and conflict in my identity because of that.
data.author: David Lindsay-Abaire

data.quote: As men get older, the toys get more expensive.
data.author: Marvin Davis

data.quote: What could be more beautiful than a dear old lady growing wise with age? Every age can be enchanting, provided you live within it.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: Nobody expects to trust his body overmuch after the age of fifty.
data.author: Alexander Hamilton

data.quote: Old age and the passage of time teach all things.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: Middle age is when your age starts to show around your middle.
data.author: Bob Hope

data.quote: Everybody is playing games. There are games now for pretty much every age, every demographic.
data.author: Jesse Schell

data.quote: I read all the time that people think I'm arrogant. They say I am cocky, a bad character. I had that from a young age. But when they meet me, they say, 'That image doesn't fit you.'

data.quote: The arrogance of age must submit to be taught by youth.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: No man was ever so completely skilled in the conduct of life, as not to receive new information from age and experience.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: I'd date someone younger or older; age doesn't matter to me. Or looks, really - it's all about maturity.
data.author: Leona Lewis

data.quote: We are in an age of technology where we sit in our little cubicles and we IM each other and Skype each other and never connect as human beings.
data.author: Sarah McLachlan

data.quote: In the summer of 1954, after several years in Austin, Minnesota, our family moved across the state to the small, rural town of Worthington, where my dad became regional manager for a life insurance company. To me, at age 7, Worthington seemed a perfectly splendid spot on the earth.
