data.quote: There is always some specific moment when we become aware that our youth is gone; but, years after, we know it was much later.
data.author: Mignon McLaughlin

data.quote: I am, as I've said, merely competent. But in an age of incompetence, that makes me extraordinary.
data.author: Billy Joel

data.quote: I have always paid income tax. I object only when it reaches a stage when I am threatened with having nothing left for my old age - which is due to start next Tuesday or Wednesday.
data.author: Noel Coward

data.quote: I believe that parents need to make nutrition education a priority in their home environment. It's crucial for good health and longevity to instill in your children sound eating habits from an early age.
data.author: Cat Cora

data.quote: Although I sometimes enjoy writing from an adult's perspective, I feel dedicated to the coming of age story - that part of a young person's life where he must make a decision that will change his life forever. I still remember what it's like to be twelve years old.
data.author: Kimberly Willis Holt

data.quote: Why do people talk of the horrors of old age? It's great. I feel like a fine old car with the parts gradually wearing out, but I'm not complaining,... Those who find growing old terrible are people who haven't done what they wanted with their lives.
data.author: Martha Gellhorn

data.quote: Living in an age of advertisement, we are perpetually disillusioned. The perfect life is spread before us every day, but it changes and withers at a touch.
data.author: J. B. Priestley

data.quote: That means that every human being - without distinction of sex, age, race, skin color, language, religion, political view, or national or social origin - possesses an inalienable and untouchable dignity.
data.author: Hans Kung

data.quote: The heresy of one age becomes the orthodoxy of the next.
data.author: Helen Keller

data.quote: Today when I think about diversity, I actually think about the word 'inclusion.' And I think this is a time of great inclusion. It's not men, it's not women alone. Whether it's geographic, it's approach, it's your style, it's your way of learning, the way you want to contribute, it's your age - it is really broad.
data.author: Ginni Rometty

data.quote: I do wish I could tell you my age but it's impossible. It keeps changing all the time.
data.author: Greer Garson

data.quote: I think that age as a number is not nearly as important as health. You can be in poor health and be pretty miserable at 40 or 50. If you're in good health, you can enjoy things into your 80s.
data.author: Bob Barker

data.quote: But the age of chivalry is gone. That of sophisters, economists, and calculators has succeeded; and the glory of Europe is extinguished forever.
data.author: Edmund Burke

data.quote: In Latino culture, the quinceanera's a big thing - it's when a girl becomes a woman. But I think age is just a number - you become a woman with the responsibilities you take on and the decisions you make. I started realizing that every day is a gift - you have every day to be thankful you're alive.
data.author: Emily Rios

data.quote: At three years of age, the child has already laid the foundations of the human personality and needs the special help of education in the school. The acquisitions he has made are such that we can say the child who enters school at three is an old man.
data.author: Maria Montessori

data.quote: We have entered an age in which education is not just a luxury permitting some men an advantage over others. It has become a necessity without which a person is defenseless in this complex, industrialized society. We have truly entered the century of the educated man.
data.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

data.quote: Sleeping is forbidden at the age of 22. It's all work and no play.
data.author: Usher

data.quote: We of Africa protest that, in this day and age, we should continue to be treated as lesser human beings than other races.
data.author: Robert Mugabe

data.quote: I always wanted to be a designer. I read books on fashion from the age of 12.
data.author: Alexander McQueen

data.quote: I knew at a young age, whether I was playing baseball or hockey or lacrosse, that my teammates were counting on me, whether it be to strike the last batter out in a baseball game or score a big goal in a hockey game.
data.author: Wayne Gretzky

data.quote: It wasn't until I left that I realised it's not weird to grow up in certain cities and, by the age of 27 or 28, for all of your friends to still be alive. I can think of a lot of kids that I knew in Chicago who were supposed to grow up but didn't.
data.author: Chance The Rapper

data.quote: Everyone in the world should have a trench coat, and there should be a trench coat for everyone in the world. It does not matter your age; it doesn't matter your gender.
data.author: Angela Ahrendts

data.quote: Romance isn't measured by how viral your proposal goes. The Internet age may try to sell you something different, but don't ever forget that viral is closely associated with sickness - so don't ever make being viral your goal.
data.author: Ann Voskamp

data.quote: Being nice to everybody, saying hello to everyone in the room, signing every autograph; it was instilled in me at a very young age that this was what I was suppose to do. But I don't think it helps at all. I see more people who are rude or arrogant being rewarded - but, this way, I can put my head on the pillow at night.
data.author: Brooke Shields

data.quote: Every child needs to have for itself not only its loving parents and siblings and friends of its own age, but a grown-up friend.
data.author: P. L. Travers

data.quote: When you start suppressing feelings at an early age, it hurts you down the road. Full expression of anger and pain is very important.
data.author: Andrew Shue

data.quote: The human heart, at whatever age, opens only to the heart that opens in return.
data.author: Maria Edgeworth

data.quote: There are mysteries which men can only guess at, which age by age they may solve only in part.
data.author: Bram Stoker

data.quote: Young man, the secret of my success is that at early age I discovered that I was not God.
data.author: Oliver Wendell Holmes, Jr.

data.quote: I was very curious about the world even at a young age, and I don't know at what point I became aware that other cultures believed in different religions, and my question was, 'Well, why don't they get to go to Heaven then?'
data.author: Brad Pitt

data.quote: It is sad to grow old but nice to ripen.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: How incessant and great are the ills with which a prolonged old age is replete.
data.author: C. S. Lewis

data.quote: Gray hairs seem to my fancy like the soft light of the moon, silvering over the evening of life.
data.author: Jean Paul

data.quote: My first recognition of age setting in was exactly on my 36th birthday. I have no idea why, on this day of all days, I looked in the mirror and realized my face no longer looked young.
data.author: Paulina Porizkova

data.quote: I want to get old gracefully. I want to have good posture, I want to be healthy and be an example to my children.
data.author: Sting

data.quote: Our scientific age demands that we provide definitions, measurements, and statistics in order to be taken seriously. Yet most of the important things in life cannot be precisely defined or measured. Can we define or measure love, beauty, friendship, or decency, for example?
data.author: Dennis Prager

data.quote: Every age can be enchanting, provided you live within it.
data.author: Brigitte Bardot

data.quote: You have to age gracefully. And that's what I love about Keith Richards. That's what I love about the Rolling Stones. They are aging gracefully. They are falling apart at the seams right before our eyes, and they are doing it gracefully. And that's the most beautiful thing that we can do.
data.author: Nikki Sixx

data.quote: The Tibetans are dirty. They wash once a year and, except for festivals, seldom change their clothes till they begin to drop off. They are healthy and hardy; even the women can carry weights of sixty pounds over the passes. They attain extreme old age; their voices are harsh and loud, and their laughter is noisy and hearty.
data.author: Isabella Bird

data.quote: A man is a fool if he drinks before he reaches the age of 50, and a fool if he doesn't afterward.
data.author: Frank Lloyd Wright

data.quote: Old age is the verdict of life.
data.author: Amelia Barr

data.quote: Old age and sickness bring out the essential characteristics of a man.
data.author: Felix Frankfurter

data.quote: No, no, I was only funny on stage, really. I, I, think I was funny as a person toward my classmates when I was very young. You know, when I was a child, up to about the age of 12.
data.author: Rowan Atkinson

data.quote: The delight of opening a new pursuit, or a new course of reading, imparts the vivacity and novelty of youth even to old age.
data.author: Isaac D'Israeli

data.quote: I was born on the other side of the tracks, in public housing in Brooklyn, New York. My dad never made more than $20,000 a year, and I grew up in a family that lost health insurance. So I was scarred at a young age with understanding what it was like to watch my parents lose access to the American dream.
data.author: Howard Schultz

data.quote: The most formative time of our lives are the years between birth and age 21, when we explore who we are and learn from those who surround us.
data.author: Ben Shapiro

data.quote: At the earliest age, when I saw a 'wet paint' sign, I had to touch the paint to see if it was wet. When I get stopped at the stoplight in the middle of the night, and there's just no cars coming, and the light is red, I go. I don't think I'm putting anyone in harm's way, and I'll just take the consequences. Because I'm a Libertarian.
data.author: Gary Johnson

data.quote: It feels like there's something for everyone in video games. It's not just a toy for a certain age group. It's steeped in the culture now.
data.author: Rich Moore

data.quote: For me, your real age is not the age on your ID. That's just a date when you were born.
data.author: Jose Mourinho

data.quote: I don't know if it's just my age or the climate or the high altitude or some of those old-cowboy values rubbing off on me, but I've grown slightly mellower living in Wyoming. I think if you ride into the West on a high horse, you pretty soon end up in a pile of manure.
data.author: Alexandra Fuller

data.quote: In every country and every age, the priest had been hostile to Liberty.
data.author: Thomas Jefferson

data.quote: I smoke ten to fifteen cigars a day. At my age I have to hold on to something.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: We are all geniuses up to the age of ten.
data.author: Aldous Huxley

data.quote: At a young age winning is not the most important thing... the important thing is to develop creative and skilled players with good confidence.
data.author: Arsene Wenger

data.quote: Time, in general, has always been a central obsession of mine - what it does to people, how it can constitute a plot all on its own. So naturally, I am interested in old age.
data.author: Anne Tyler

data.quote: I figured out it was a social thing, what women were allowed to do. At a very young age, I decided I was not going to follow women's rules.
data.author: Joan Jett

data.quote: I shall not grow conservative with age.
data.author: Elizabeth Cady Stanton

data.quote: You had to learn at a certain age what sarcasm is, you know?
data.author: Penny Marshall

data.quote: I believe in miracles. At the age of 13, I was on holiday in Moscow with my mother. It was the only trip I took in my whole childhood. We stepped off a metro train and were approached by a talent scout who told me that she wanted to sign me to her modeling agency.
data.author: Olga Kurylenko

data.quote: Up until the age of 12, I went to dog shows every weekend. Mum showed beagles. It's a really competitive and eclectic world filled with characters who wear interesting outfits - similar to 'Toddlers & Tiaras,' but with dogs.
data.author: Rebel Wilson

data.quote: I find age such a foreign concept. I have to be reminded. I still have the extraordinary feeling of adventure, striking out into unknown fields.
data.author: William Shatner

data.quote: When I first started swinging a bat, I swung righty. So one time, my dad came home, and he wanted to see my batting stance. So I showed him. He says, 'You don't hit right-handed. You hit left-handed.' At that age I didn't even really think about it. Just like 'all right,' and I switched hands. He said I'd thank him later.
data.author: Prince Fielder

data.quote: I love coming of age stories that have struggle.
data.author: Aaron Paul

data.quote: Be on the alert to recognize your prime at whatever time of your life it may occur.
data.author: Muriel Spark

data.quote: I was taught from a very early age that I had to work twice as hard to get half as much. That was the world I grew up in - a very strong work ethic.
data.author: Larry Wilmore

data.quote: A graceful and honorable old age is the childhood of immortality.
data.author: Pindar

data.quote: Girls' inner critics are starting to reveal themselves at a younger and younger age. And body image issues are an aspect of their lives which is causing them low self esteem and day-to-day suffering.
data.author: Elizabeth Berkley

data.quote: At the age of 12 I won the school prize for Best English Essay. The prize was a copy of Somerset Maugham's 'Introduction To Modern English And American Literature.' To this day I keep it on the shelf between my collection of Forester's works and the little urn that contains my mother's ashes.
data.author: Wilbur Smith

data.quote: The closing years of life are like the end of a masquerade party, when the masks are dropped.
data.author: Cesare Pavese

data.quote: Old age is a shipwreck.
data.author: Charles de Gaulle

data.quote: The answer to old age is to keep one's mind busy and to go on with one's life as if it were interminable. I always admired Chekhov for building a new house when he was dying of tuberculosis.
data.author: Leon Edel

data.quote: When I turned 60, it didn't bother me at all.
data.author: Yoko Ono

data.quote: The question isn't at what age I want to retire, it's at what income.
data.author: George Foreman

data.quote: I would go out with women my age, but there are no women my age.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: Industrialization based on machinery, already referred to as a characteristic of our age, is but one aspect of the revolution that is being wrought by technology.
data.author: Emily Greene Balch

data.quote: Despite what anti-aging ads say, growing older can be better. I feel better in my skin, 100 percent. You have greater effects of gravity, but the better sense of yourself you have is something I wouldn't trade. Women who lie about their age - 'why?'
data.author: Demi Moore

data.quote: We tend to think of age only in time, but I don't think it has much to do with time at all; there's a whole load of other things. I've met 16-year-olds who are old and 90-year-olds who are young.
data.author: Roger Daltrey

data.quote: I'll tell you, there is nothing better in life than being a late bloomer. I believe that success can happen at any time and at any age.
data.author: Salma Hayek

data.quote: There are no college courses to build up self-esteem or high school or elementary school. If you don't get those values at a early age, nurtured in your home, you don't get them.
data.author: T. D. Jakes

data.quote: Harper Lee and Truman Capote became friends as next-door neighbors in the late 1920s, when they were about kindergarten age. From the start, they recognized in each other "an apartness," as Capote later expressed it; and both loved reading. When Lee's father gave them an old Underwood typewriter, they began writing original stories together.
data.author: Charles J. Shields

data.quote: What's changed is we now have good anatomical, geological, archaeological evidence that Neanderthals are not our ancestors. When I wrote 'Lucy,' I considered Neanderthals ancestors of modern humans. We have gone back twice the age of Lucy, six million years. And we see that upright bipedal walking goes back that far in time.
data.author: Donald Johanson

data.quote: It is imperative to change the way we look at education. We should invest in the foundation of school readiness from birth to age 5.
data.author: James Heckman

data.quote: We're seeing a new 'Gilded Age,' where inheritance is a deciding factor in who becomes the wealthiest.
data.author: Annalee Newitz

data.quote: Until the age of five, my parents spoke to me in Chinese or a combination of Chinese and English, but they didn't force me to speak Mandarin. In retrospect, this was sad, because they believed that my chance of doing well in America hinged on my fluency in English. Later, as an adult, I wanted to learn Chinese.
data.author: Amy Tan

data.quote: Some people survived the neolithic age by being brave, others by being cowardly and smart.
data.author: Phil Lord

data.quote: Middle age is when you've met so many people that every new person you meet reminds you of someone else.
data.author: Ogden Nash

data.quote: In this age, which believes that there is a short cut to everything, the greatest lesson to be learned is that the most difficult way is, in the long run, the easiest.
data.author: Henry Miller

data.quote: The older I grow the more I distrust the familiar doctrine that age brings wisdom.
data.author: H. L. Mencken

data.quote: The Olympic Spirit is neither the property of one race nor of one age.
data.author: Pierre de Coubertin

data.quote: I suppose when they reach a certain age some men are afraid to grow up. It seems the older the men get, the younger their new wives get.
data.author: Elizabeth Taylor

data.quote: The mind that is wise mourns less for what age takes away than what it leaves behind.
data.author: William Wordsworth

data.quote: Old age is far more than white hair, wrinkles, the feeling that it is too late and the game finished, that the stage belongs to the rising generations. The true evil is not the weakening of the body, but the indifference of the soul.
data.author: Andre Maurois

data.quote: We are living in the machine age. For the first time in history the comedian has been compelled to supply himself with jokes and comedy material to compete with the machine. Whether he knows it or not, the comedian is on a treadmill to oblivion.
data.author: Fred Allen

data.quote: 'Beauty' is a currency system like the gold standard. Like any economy, it is determined by politics, and in the modern age in the West is is the last, best belief system that keeps male dominance intact.
data.author: Naomi Wolf

data.quote: My solution to the problem would be to tell the North Vietnamese Communists frankly that they've got to drawn in their horns and stop their aggression or we're going to bomb them into the stone age.
data.author: Curtis LeMay

data.quote: The culture of independent film criticism has totally gone down the drain and this seems to come with the territory of the consumer age that we are now living in.
data.author: Wim Wenders

data.quote: The golden age has not passed it lies in the future.
data.author: Paul Signac

data.quote: We are living in a new age of energy supply anxiety.
data.author: Daniel Yergin

data.quote: The poetical language of an age should be the current language heightened.
data.author: Gerard Manley Hopkins

data.quote: Youth is a silly, vapid state, Old age with fears and ills is rife; This simple boon I beg of Fate - A thousand years of Middle Life.
data.author: Carolyn Wells

data.quote: A man loves the meat in his youth that he cannot endure in his age.
data.author: William Shakespeare

data.quote: Whoever, fleeing marriage and the sorrows that women cause, does not wish to wed comes to a deadly old age.
data.author: Hesiod

data.quote: The history of the Victorian Age will never be written: we know too much about it.
data.author: Lytton Strachey

data.quote: Memory in youth is active and easily impressible; in old age it is comparatively callous to new impressions, but still retains vividly those of earlier years.
data.author: Charlotte Bronte

data.quote: There's no excuse for fur in this day and age.
data.author: Stella McCartney

data.quote: There's no way to approach anything in an objective way. We're completely subjective; our view of the world is completely controlled by who we are as human beings, as men or women, by our age, our history, our profession, by the state of the world.
data.author: Charlie Kaufman

data.quote: My father was sleepless most of his life. So by the age of five, I was awake with him all night long, watching bad television or we'd lie in the same bed, and I'd read my comic books while he read his latest spy or mystery novel.
data.author: Sherman Alexie

data.quote: I'm well past the age where I'm acceptable. You get to a certain age and you are forbidden access. You're not going to get the kind of coverage that you would like in music magazines, you're not going to get played on radio and you're not going to get played on television. I have to survive on word of mouth.
data.author: David Bowie

data.quote: I came of age believing that, no matter what happened, I would always be able to support myself.
data.author: William J. Clinton

data.quote: I don't care about age very much.
data.author: Chinua Achebe

data.quote: Men are allowed to age. Men are allowed to gain weight. Men are allowed to be quirky looking.
data.author: Janeane Garofalo

data.quote: I have a fear of poverty in old age. I have this vision of myself living in a skip and eating cat food. It's because I'm freelance, and I've never had a proper job. I don't have a pension, and my savings are dwindling. I always thought someone would just come along and look after me.
data.author: Jenny Eclair

data.quote: My mother is an incredibly beautiful woman who has laughed at every single thing my father's ever said. At a young age, my brother and I understood that if you can make girls laugh, you can punch well above your weight class.
data.author: Seth Meyers

data.quote: Sometimes I think it would be easier to avoid old age, to die young, but then you'd never complete your life, would you? You'd never wholly know you.
data.author: Marilyn Monroe

data.quote: When somebody who makes movies for a living - either as an actor, writer, producer or director - lives to be a certain age, you have to admire them. It is an act of courage to make a film - a courage for which you are not prepared in the rest of life. It is very hard and very destructive. But we do it because we love it.
data.author: John Carpenter

data.quote: 'Stand By Me' was really great for me and my buddies we'd all watch that together because that was us - we were down in the creek and hanging out every day and going on little adventures. I had about sixteen friends who are all about the same age as me and lived in a three-block radius. We spent our entire childhood down in that creek.
data.author: Scoot McNairy

data.quote: You can't be crazy and wild when you're on work time. But, I like it, in that sense I think it makes you a better person for having matured at a younger age.
data.author: Kay Panabaker

data.quote: I grew up in this poor place, with very limited circumstances, at about 16 years of age was sent by my family to work, and instead of remaining in the position into which I was sent, I somehow worked my way out of it without any help from anyone, just luck.
data.author: Jamaica Kincaid

data.quote: I never grew up thinking the goal in life was to be a millionaire. All the way through college, I had a part-time job. I worked hard to get the things that you need at that age.
data.author: Cecelia Ahern

data.quote: I like texting as much as the next kidult - and embrace it as yet more evidence, along with email, that we live now in the post-aural age, when an unsolicited phone call is, thankfully, becoming more and more understood to be an unspeakable social solecism, tantamount to an impertinent invasion of privacy.
data.author: Will Self

data.quote: The number of people my age, younger now, a whole generation younger, who are fiercely bright, over-educated, under-employed and who are politicised and purposeless really upsets me. It's soul-destroying.
data.author: Benedict Cumberbatch

data.quote: Women have made tons of progress. But we still have a small percentage of the top jobs in any industry, in any nation in the world. I think that's partly because from a very young age, we encourage our boys to lead and we call our girls bossy.
data.author: Sheryl Sandberg

data.quote: If a brain is exercised properly, anyone can grow intelligence, at any age, and potentially by a lot. Or you can just let your brain idle - and watch it slowly, inexorably, go to seed like a sedentary body.
data.author: Michael Merzenich

data.quote: The reason I always loved 'The Omen' so much, and what has always been scariest to me, is anything to do with God. Anything to do with God is quite frightening because fear is something that's very much expressed in a church environment, and I grew up in one. And the fear of God was very much instilled me at a very young age.
data.author: KaDee Strickland

data.quote: We, as artists, we have the right to express ourselves. That is our first amendment, freedom of speech. But I also believe that we have an obligation to the youth to be somewhat responsible in what we say on records. But I think that comes with age. I think that comes with artists growing up and becoming assured of who they are as people.
data.author: Ja Rule

data.quote: My nieces and my nephews think the only thing that I do is 'Ice Age.' That's fine with me because pretty soon they'll grow up enough to realize that I suck or that my time has passed, whichever it might be.
data.author: Denis Leary

data.quote: I don't care about age very much. I think back to the old people I knew when I was growing up, and they always seemed larger than life.
data.author: Chinua Achebe

data.quote: When you grumble about a taxi being dirty, people your own age will absolutely agree with you, whereas younger people say, 'You should be so lucky to have a taxi - I walk to work!' So I have lots of young friends, who fortunately don't treat me as a guru, a person that knows all the answers.
data.author: Ian Mckellen

data.quote: There's no such thing as old age. I'm no different now than I was 50 years ago. I'm just having more fun.
data.author: Philip Johnson

data.quote: A lot of people are frightened by old age - by being around people who are, basically, on their way out - but I'm fascinated by it. It's an amazing thing to be around someone who has had a life well lived.
data.author: Cate Blanchett

data.quote: Truly, learning appears to be a reverse geometric progression with experiences at one hour, one day, one month or one year dramatically more influential and formative than later experiences. As has often been quoted, 85% of brain development takes place by age 3, and yet we spend only 4% of our educational dollars by that point.
data.author: George Kaiser

data.quote: How young can you die of old age?
data.author: Steven Wright

data.quote: You are 27 or 28 right? It is very tough to live at that age. When nothing is sure. I have sympathy with you.
data.author: Haruki Murakami

data.quote: Save your money. You're going to need twice as much money in your old age as you think.
data.author: Michael Caine

data.quote: The name 'Wiz' comes from me being the youngest dude in my age group of people that I hung out with. I was pretty good at anything I tried to do, so they would call me a young wiz.
data.author: Wiz Khalifa

data.quote: When our son's autism was diagnosed at the age of 2, there was no clear prognosis. We didn't even know if he'd ever learn to talk. But we found talented people to work with him and he improved, slowly at first and then more rapidly.
data.author: Claire Scovell LaZebnik

data.quote: I suppose I'm trying to build an architecture that's as timeless as possible, although we're all creatures of our age.
data.author: David Chipperfield

data.quote: In order to dance professionally, you have to start at a young age. No matter what, your muscle structure and your bones have to be groomed from a very young age. Nobody wakes up at 17 and decides to become a ballet dancer.
data.author: Amanda Schull

data.quote: When kids are young, before the age of ten, there is a critical window of opportunity when their habits and motivations can be influenced.
data.author: Richard Attias

data.quote: If you're old, don't try to change yourself, change your environment.
data.author: B. F. Skinner

data.quote: All diseases run into one, old age.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: Every man over forty is a scoundrel.
data.author: George Bernard Shaw

data.quote: Being seventy is not a sin.
data.author: Golda Meir

data.quote: The denunciation of the young is a necessary part of the hygiene of older people, and greatly assists the circulation of the blood.
data.author: Logan Pearsall Smith

data.quote: Advice in old age is foolish for what can be more absurd than to increase our provisions for the road the nearer we approach to our journey's end.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: As I approve of a youth that has something of the old man in him, so I am no less pleased with an old man that has something of the youth. He that follows this rule may be old in body, but can never be so in mind.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: Minds ripen at very different ages.
data.author: Stevie Wonder

data.quote: A man knows when he is growing old because he begins to look like his father.
data.author: Gabriel Garcia Marquez

data.quote: Every time I paint a portrait I lose a friend.
data.author: John Singer Sargent

data.quote: As you age naturally, your family shows more and more on your face. If you deny that, you deny your heritage.
data.author: Frances Conroy

data.quote: Childhood: the period of human life intermediate between the idiocy of infancy and the folly of youth - two removes from the sin of manhood and three from the remorse of age.
data.author: Ambrose Bierce

data.quote: The enemy of society is middle class and the enemy of life is middle age.
data.author: Orson Welles

data.quote: To separate children from others of similar age and qualifications solely because of their race generates a feeling of inferiority as to their status in the community that may affect their hearts and minds in a way unlikely ever to be undone.
data.author: Earl Warren

data.quote: After 12 years, the old butterflies came back. Well, I guess at my age you call them moths.
data.author: Franco Harris

data.quote: An artist must be a reactionary. He has to stand out against the tenor of the age and not go flopping along.
data.author: Andre Maurois

data.quote: A moment comes, which comes but rarely in history, when we step out from the old to the new; when an age ends; and when the soul of a nation long suppressed finds utterance.
data.author: Jawaharlal Nehru

data.quote: When I came to Los Angeles, it was the first time that I ever felt like I belong somewhere. Not because it was wacky, but because people here understood what I felt like to perform, and there were other kids my age who wanted to do it. I didn't get looked at as God, you freak.
data.author: Jennifer Love Hewitt

data.quote: This is the first age that's ever paid much attention to the future, which is a little ironic since we may not have one.
data.author: Arthur C. Clarke

data.quote: A tart temper never mellows with age, and a sharp tongue is the only edged tool that grows keener with constant use.
data.author: Washington Irving

data.quote: Nice to be here? At my age it's nice to be anywhere.
data.author: George Burns

data.quote: Interest is the spur of the people, but glory that of great souls. Invention is the talent of youth, and judgment of age.
data.author: Jonathan Swift

data.quote: Revenge is the naked idol of the worship of a semi-barbarous age.
data.author: Percy Bysshe Shelley

data.quote: Rashness belongs to youth prudence to old age.
data.author: Marcus Tullius Cicero

data.quote: Age imprints more wrinkles in the mind than it does on the face.
data.author: Michel de Montaigne

data.quote: Youth, what man's age is like to be, doth show; We may our ends by our beginnings know.
data.author: John Denham

data.quote: You live in a deranged age, more deranged that usual, because in spite of great scientific and technological advances, man has not the faintest idea of who he is or what he is doing.
data.author: Walker Percy

data.quote: At the age of four with paper hats and wooden swords we're all Generals. Only some of us never grow out of it.
data.author: Peter Ustinov

data.quote: The crucial task of old age is balance: keeping just well enough, just brave enough, just gay and interested and starkly honest enough to remain a sentient human being.
data.author: Florida Scott-Maxwell

data.quote: You can judge your age by the amount of pain you feel when you come in contact with a new idea.
data.author: Pearl S. Buck

data.quote: From birth to age 18 a girl needs good parents. From 18 to 35 she needs good looks. From 35 to 55 she needs a good personality. From 55 on, she needs good cash.
data.author: Sophie Tucker

data.quote: Morality comes with the sad wisdom of age, when the sense of curiosity has withered.
data.author: Graham Greene

data.quote: Believe me, that was a happy age, before the days of architects, before the days of builders.
data.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

data.quote: What makes old age hard to bear is not the failing of one's faculties, mental and physical, but the burden of one's memories.
data.author: W. Somerset Maugham

data.quote: I don't believe in happy endings, but I do believe in happy travels, because ultimately, you die at a very young age, or you live long enough to watch your friends die. It's a mean thing, life.
data.author: George Clooney

data.quote: Experts tell us that 90% of all brain development occurs by the age of five. If we don't begin thinking about education in the early years, our children are at risk of falling behind by the time they start Kindergarten.
data.author: Bob Ehrlich

data.quote: Middle age is when your broad mind and narrow waist begin to change places.
data.author: E. Joseph Cossman

data.quote: There have been studies that clearly state that children who are exposed to arts education at a young age will in fact do markedly better in their SAT tests.
data.author: Marvin Hamlisch

data.quote: Ours is the age of substitutes: instead of language, we have jargon: instead of principles, slogans: and, instead of genuine ideas, bright ideas.
data.author: Eric Bentley

data.quote: This is an exciting time. I believe we stand at the edge of a new age - a Golden Age - of freedom that will rival any of the great eras of world history because it will be the entire world itself that is changing.
data.author: Joe Lieberman

data.quote: From the age of six I wanted to be an artist. At that point I meant a painter, but it turned out what I really meant was I was someone who was very interested in watching the world and making copies of it.
data.author: Reynolds Price

data.quote: I really took filmmaking very seriously... It was an honor and then a crutch also, because at a young age, I was like, I guess I'm a serious filmmaker. I never set out to be a serious filmmaker. I just set out to make movies.

data.quote: It is people's hearts that move the age.
data.author: Herbie Hancock

data.quote: Dissents speak to a future age.
data.author: Ruth Bader Ginsburg

data.quote: I wanted to do two things when I was growing up, about your age. I wanted to play in the NBA, and I wanted to be a businessman after my basketball career was over, and that is what I am doing now.

data.quote: I ask myself why I do it. Maybe it's to prove I'm still around. It takes a lot out of my body. I'm not an NBA player anymore. At my age, very few people can handle it.
data.author: Jerry Stiller

data.quote: It was at this moment that I wrote my first important paper in theoretical physics. I was 32 years old, 5 years beyond the alleged age of senility for theorists.
data.author: Robert B. Laughlin

data.quote: State and local government, with financial support from the federal government, should offer a program to educate and train foster children for employment and provide them with financial assistance, as needed, until they reach age 21.
data.author: Charles Bass

data.quote: I take advantage of every thing I can - age, hair, disability - because my cause is just.
data.author: Marjory Stoneman Douglas

data.quote: We grew up in a very creative environment and were exposed to the arts at a very young age, so it's not a surprise that all of us are in some form of the arts.
data.author: Spike Lee

data.quote: At the age of fifteen my grandmother became the concubine of a warlord general.
data.author: Jung Chang

data.quote: In this age of consumerism film criticism all over the world - in America first but also in Europe - has become something that caters for the movie industry instead of being a counterbalance.

data.quote: We now have an opportunity, though, to do something we didn't do in the industrial age, and that is to get a leg up on this, to bring the public in quickly, to have an informed debate.

data.quote: Look, it's to the point where kids are getting Botox. It's insane. We're not allowed to age.
data.author: Rosanna Arquette

data.quote: Around age 40 I put on twenty pounds. I had always had a perfect metabolism. But, my metabolism betrayed me as it does most people, except a very rare few who will always be thin.
data.author: Suzanne Somers

data.quote: People tend to become more emotionally intelligent as they age and mature.
data.author: Daniel Goleman

data.quote: I didn't have any concept of age or authority. I remember realising, Oh, the world has rules and we don't.

data.quote: The young people have MTV and rock and roll. Why would they go to read poetry? Poetry belongs to the Stone Age. It awakens in us perceptions that go back to those times.
data.author: Robert Morgan

data.quote: I started playing ukulele first for 2 years from age 9 to 11 and got my first guitar and got inspired by blues I heard on the radio that turned me on and I started learning myself.

data.quote: The love story for me was the nature of the love and not the age of the lovers.
data.author: Kate Capshaw

data.quote: I reluctantly left the series because a) my age. I'm 68 tomorrow and time is very precious for me to spend time at home with my family and especially with the grandchildren. They're aged 7 and 5. After three years I became homesick for my home.

data.quote: If you look at body fat, it seems to increase with age, even though your weight does not. That's a physiological fact of aging, they say. Heck it is. It is an adaptive effect of aging.

data.quote: If you watch Cheers, in 12 years they didn't age a day.
data.author: William Devane

data.quote: I don't need you to remind me of my age. I have a bladder to do that for me.

data.quote: I was a very sickly kid. While I was in the hospital at age 7, my Dad brought me a stack of comic books to keep me occupied. I was hooked.
data.author: Len Wein

data.quote: I hate to mention age, but I come from an era when we weren't consumed by technology and television.
data.author: Jimmy Buffett

data.quote: Every year 3.1 million Indian children die before the age of 5, mostly from diseases of poverty like diarrhea.
data.author: Nicholas D. Kristof

data.quote: Yes, my life is a life of combat; I can say that this has never stopped for a single instant. It is a combat that started for me at the age of 16. I'm 90 years old now, and my motivation hasn't changed; it's the same fervour that drives me.

data.quote: Because of Mozart, it's all over after the age of seven.
data.author: Wendy Wasserstein

data.quote: If civilization has risen from the Stone Age, it can rise again from the Wastepaper Age.
data.author: Jacques Barzun

data.quote: Another belief of mine; that everyone else my age is an adult, whereas I am merely in disguise.
data.author: Margaret Atwood

data.quote: In an age robbed of religious symbols, going to the shops replaces going to the church. We have a free choice, but at a price. We can win experience, but never achieve innocence. Marx knew that the epic activities of the modern world involve not lance and sword but dry goods.
data.author: Stephen Bayley

data.quote: Error is acceptable as long as we are young but one must not drag it along into old age.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: An age which is incapable of poetry is incapable of any kind of literature except the cleverness of a decadence.
data.author: Raymond Chandler

data.quote: No lie ever reaches old age.
data.author: Sophocles

data.quote: What turns me on about the digital age, what excited me personally, is that you have closed the gap between dreaming and doing. You see, it used to be that if you wanted to make a record of a song, you needed a studio and a producer. Now, you need a laptop.
data.author: Bono

data.quote: I'm asked all the time in interviews about who I am, and I know a few people my age who have a strong sense of self, but I couldn't say I know myself and sum it up and give it to you in a little package. I don't know myself at all yet.

data.quote: I believe that investing in our children's development from the earliest age is the single most important contribution we can make to the health and wellbeing of our citizens, their capacity and the future prosperity of our state.
data.author: Jay Weatherill

data.quote: We grew up in abject poverty. Acting, writing scripts and skits were a way of escaping our environment at a very young age.

data.quote: I remember failing reading in school at a young age, and you just kinda get left behind and I felt helpless.
data.author: Kevin O'Leary

data.quote: I think it's very hard in this day and age to raise little girls with morals, ethics and values, and them knowing that they are precious creations and that they are important.
data.author: Angie Harmon

data.quote: I've reached the age of self-knowledge, so I don't know anything. People who claim that they know something are responsible for most of the fuss in the world.
data.author: Wislawa Szymborska

data.quote: I really don't get nervous when I perform -it's more of an exciting feeling than anything else. But put me in a classroom with kids my age and have me take a test and yeah, I'll be nervous!

data.quote: The quicker we get rid of the lobby system the better for all of us. I don't think in this day and age it is tenable to have these nods and winks, and on-the-record and off-the-record briefings.
data.author: Charles Kennedy

data.quote: I was never really sure what I wanted to do - I'm in awe of these people who knew at age 10 or 12 they wanted to be a brain surgeon, and they did it, and they still are.
data.author: Jerry Doyle

data.quote: You need some insecurity if you're an actor. It keeps the pot boiling. I haven't yet started to think about retiring. I was shocked when I heard about Paul Newman retiring at age 82. Most actors just fade away like old soldiers.
data.author: Al Pacino

data.quote: We live in an age of mediocrity.
data.author: Lauren Bacall

data.quote: I think the most exciting thing is that you expect people our age to know the music, but actually a lot of kids know the music, and if anything is left, we have left really good music, and that's the important part, not the mop-tops or whatever.

data.quote: In fact, my courage and my bravery at a young age was the thing I was bullied for, a kind of 'Who do you think you are?'

data.quote: The age in which we live, this non-stop distraction, is making it more impossible for the young generation to ever have the curiosity or discipline... because you need to be alone to find out anything.

data.quote: I wear clothes that most people in the Midwest would probably deem inappropriate at my age. And I rock a bikini all summer long. I know that it's not normal, but I just don't care. I live once.

data.quote: Raised by an irresponsible mother during the Great Depression in the Jim Crow south, my father was on his own from the age of 13.
data.author: Larry Elder

data.quote: Whether you're gay or straight, with a physical disability, your skin's a different color, it's absurd in this age to not be aware and be concerned of the inequity in rights.
data.author: Carson Kressley

data.quote: Cable is a dynamic and highly innovative industry, providing cutting edge services and content that Americans love. The broadband platform the industry has deployed is a critical part of the infrastructure needed to realize our national ambition to be a great nation in the Information Age.
data.author: Michael K. Powell

data.quote: I grew up in the suburbs among highly educated people, in a house crammed with books. It was a culture rich in ideas, stimulation, entertainment, and mental activity, all helpful to the nurture of an imaginative child who wanted from an early age to be a writer.
data.author: Stephen Hunter

data.quote: To write a story about New York that only deals with people in your age and socioeconomic bracket, that feels dishonest to me. So much of New York comes from everyone bumping into each other.
data.author: Josh Radnor

data.quote: The bottom line is that we have entered an age when local communities need to invest in themselves. Federal and state dollars are becoming more and more scarce for American cities. Political and civic leaders in local communities need to make a compelling case for this investment.
data.author: Mick Cornett

data.quote: We all want to be special, to stand out; there's nothing wrong with this. The irony is that every human being is special to start with, because we're unique to start with. data.author: Karl Marlantes

data.quote: My big running discovery was around Stanley Park in Vancouver. Miss it. That's a six-mile loop. Now I smile when I get four miles done. Age is a beast.
data.author: Michael Weatherly

data.quote: I actually think the whole concept of retirement is a bit stupid, so yes, I do want to do something else. data.author: Stuart Rose

data.quote: The Industrial Age is not sustainable. It's not sustainable in ecological terms, and it's not sustainable in human terms.
data.author: Peter Senge

data.quote: My dad says that when I was two or three I used to go out dressed as a different character every day. I remember thinking it was perfectly normal to wear different coloured shoes and carry a pink umbrella. But now I've got a goddaughter of that age I realise it's not normal at all.

data.quote: You start at a young age, going on auditions, and you think you did a good job and expect to get that role, and you don't, and it's a letdown, a disappointment. So you tell yourself to just do the work and disconnect, because you have no control over the outcome.

data.quote: There are things that tend to moderate with age. Schizophrenia is somewhat like that.
data.author: John Forbes Nash, Jr.

data.quote: We live in an age of great jitteriness in the financial markets. And there's no doubt at all, I think, that the volume of computer-traded stocks has helped contribute to that.
data.author: Robert Harris

data.quote: Teachers are not supposed to be repositories of information which they dish out. That is from an age when there were no other repositories of information, other than books or teachers, neither of which were portable. A lot of my big task is retraining these teachers.
data.author: Sugata Mitra

data.quote: I think no matter what age you are, you know when you love something in your heart.
data.author: Cindy Busby

data.quote: Religion triggers a lot of emotions in me, most of which stem from being raised Jewish in a very Baptist community in the South. I didn't believe any of it from an early age - the clubby quality of whatever religion or church you belonged to, Judaism included. It just struck me as foolish.
data.author: David Cross

data.quote: The story of 'Mirror Mirror' is in many ways a story about evolution. It's about the evolution of a child into an adult. It's about the evolution of history, too, from the darkness of the Middle Ages into the light of the Age of Reason.

data.quote: It used to cost money to disclose and distribute information. In the digital age it costs money not to.
data.author: Heather Brooke

data.quote: The bulk of my fans are my age, and I'm aging at the same rate they are. That makes me relevant. They like hearing what I have to say. I work hard at it, but it's addicting, really.

data.quote: I am not a big technology person. I don't go on the Internet really much at all. Drawing is like a zen thing; it's private, which in this day and age is harder to come by.

data.quote: I know that might sound silly coming from someone my age, but I remember on my 14th birthday having a crisis like my mom should be having. data.quote: I think people under age 55 come to Vegas with a certain sense of irony.

data.quote: Solitude is good in the evening. Dublin is a quiet city when you get to a certain age, when your friends settle down and have kids. Nothing much happens here.

data.quote: I knew from the age of five what I wanted to do. The one thing I could do was draw. I couldn't draw that much better than some of the other kids, but I cared more and I wanted it badly.

data.quote: Prom has all the elements of a popular story. It reeks of all-Americanness, tension, drama. It has romance. Pretty dresses. Dancing. Limos. High school. Coming of age.

data.quote: Soon, I'm going to meet somebody around my own age, and she's going to be smart and beautiful, and I'm going to date her daughter.
data.author: Bob Saget

data.quote: Two of my three siblings are older, so I suppose I learned from them and became a very avid reader at a young age, which I think enough cannot be said for what you can discover through literature.

data.quote: A lot of movie stars are not great actors; they're just very good-looking. And when they start to age and they don't have the looks any more, then it's over.

data.quote: A lot of people who start work at a very young age never grow up because they never got that opportunity to be a child, so they hold on to that and still do a lot of childish, silly things.

data.quote: In 1977, at age ten, I was cast on the TV sitcom 'Good Times.' My character was Penny, an abused child in desperate need of love. I really didn't want to do the show. I didn't want to be away from my family.
data.author: Janet Jackson

data.quote: I've never been willing to lie about my age. Why on earth would I want to tell people I'm 35, which I'm not, and have them say, 'Oh that's nice,' when I could tell them I'm 47, which I am, and have them look at me and go, 'Whoa!'. I'm not afraid of aging. I stopped being afraid of life a long time ago.

data.quote: The most inspiring piece of advice I've gotten is simply to persevere. My mom taught me to always keep going no matter what from an early age. When it feels too difficult to push forward, I always remind myself, 'This too shall pass,' and then I redouble my efforts.

data.quote: In this age of the electronic media and the mass distribution of the printed word, God will hold us accountable if we do not now move the Book of Mormon in a monumental way.
data.author: Ezra Taft Benson

data.quote: We have to program the mind of the public that age is not ugly. Age is just age. Wake up, American children, and stop listening to other people's voices. data.quote: Like the rest of the city, LAX is coming of age.

data.quote: A house with any kind of age will have dozens of stories to tell. I suppose if a novelist could live long enough, one could base an entire oeuvre on the lives that weave in and out of an antique house.

data.quote: In an instant, the law was transformed: from the last passenger on the safe-haven bandwagon to a pioneer into uncharted territory. data.author: Wil S. Hylton

data.quote: I go back to family: 'Ice Age' was about disparate characters rejected by their own kind. They come together to save the child. 'Despicable Me' is about redefining what a family could be. It has a visual distinction and an experimental quality.
data.author: Chris Meledandri

data.quote: I want to do roles that take women a step farther. I don't want to be slotted into anything. But if I get a brilliant role which requires me to be a mother, then I will do it. data.quote: I feel like old age in America is a very sad thing. I have been many different places around the world where getting older is something you look forward to.

data.quote: Old age may have its limitations and challenges, but in spite of them, our latter years can be some of the most rewarding and fulfilling of our lives.

data.quote: I myself got married at a very young age. It has always intrigued me because marriage is very synthetic in an otherwise natural world.

data.quote: You label somebody 'New Age,' and that's automatic mockery: 'She cannot possibly be a serious thinker.'

data.quote: Grief is exhausting. When you learn - maybe through my age or experience - trying to harness the energy, whatever it is, muted energy or a concentration to find yourself in a place? You try to use it for when it's really necessary and can arrive.

data.quote: That's the privilege of old age: You don't have to remember.
data.author: Alan Arkin

data.quote: There's a lot of things lost in the Digital Age.
data.author: Ira Sachs

data.quote: I embrace old age. Look, I'm never going to dunk on LeBron James, and I've learned to accept that. I got a pretty good life, and I'm very fortunate, and I have my blessings.

data.author: Dennis Prager

data.quote: I get recognized in the street really frequently, which is really shocking. I'm excruciatingly wary of any female under the age of 19. Even when some of them come up to me, they're usually very cordial, nice and polite.

data.quote: Everyone has an internal age, a time in life when one is, if not one's best, then at very least one's most authentic self. I always felt that my internal clock was calibrated somewhere between 47 and 53 years old.

data.quote: When I was in my teens and 20s, I looked to older Italian and French women. They always seemed so incredibly attractive to me because of their confidence. data.quote: Here's my theory: If a person gets worldwide fame at a young age, they're emotionally frozen at that moment. For me, that's 15 to 18, so you find yourself in your mid-20s being a glorified 15-year-old. What could possibly go wrong?
data.author: Rob Lowe

data.quote: It's a tender and complicated dance, watching our parents age. We become protective in ways we never were before, and we study them with a mix of sadness and curiosity: Is this what we will be like when we are their age? We tell ourselves to be patient - just answer the same question again as if it wasn't answered a moment ago.
data.author: Patti Davis

data.quote: Whatever China I'd been born into, I would probably still have become a painter - I loved sketching portraits as a child, and began art classes at the age 7. But if China hadn't been under Maoist rule, I might never have become a writer.
data.author: Ma Jian

data.quote: I did telemarketing for years, starting at the age of 16, just selling steak knives to old people. Old people go through a weird amount of steak knives. I also sold straight meat over the telephone.
data.author: Adam DeVine

data.quote: I was named after my Jewish grandfather who left Poland early in the 20th century. What I knew from an early age was that he had lived most of his life in England, his Jewish wife had died, and he married a non-Jewish woman who was my grandmother.
data.author: Morris Gleitzman

data.quote: If you are fortunate in life, age and knowledge breed compassion.
data.author: Ronnie Musgrove

data.quote: My love for American music and American movies is from an early age. I was 10 or 11 when I heard Fats Domino and Little Richard and Buddy Holly. And the movies, my dad used to take my brother and I to the movies every Friday. It was incredible: we got to see just about every movie that came out for a period of years.
data.author: Ian McLagan

data.quote: Loving someone liberates the lover as well as the beloved. And that kind of love comes with age.
data.author: Maya Angelou

data.quote: Each age, it is found, must write its own books; or rather, each generation for the next succeeding.
data.author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

data.quote: I remember at the age of five travelling on a trolley car with my mother past a group of women on a picket line at a textile plant, seeing them being viciously beaten by security people. So that kind of thing stayed with me.
data.author: Noam Chomsky

data.quote: I don't like it when people who are young act like they're 40. That's taking too much on. Putting up a shield and trying to act like you're so mature or whatever - I don't try to act mature. Some people might say I'm mature for my age, but it's not something I'm trying to do, you know? I'm just me.
data.author: Taylor Swift

data.quote: We were never supposed to live until 40. We were built to self-destruct at 30, whether from cancer or mental illness. We're all going way beyond our expiration date.
data.author: Douglas Coupland

data.quote: If Beethoven had been killed in a plane crash at the age of 22, it would have changed the history of music and of aviation.
data.author: Tom Stoppard

data.quote: Age merely shows what children we remain.
data.author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

data.quote: People forget how dominant Public Enemy became in the mid '80s. No one talks about how transformative they were. And then that led to the '90s and the sort of East Coast v. West Coast stuff, which is kinda when I came of age.
data.author: Marco Rubio

data.quote: You've gotta understand that with branding and the way things are promoted, in our day and age, your older movie stars are not reachable or accessible because they're not a part of the whole social media world.
data.author: Kevin Hart

data.quote: The shades of respectability begin to close about the greying head.
data.author: Mason Cooley

data.quote: 'Bombing Afghanistan back into the Stone Age' was quite a favourite headline for some wobbly liberals. The slogan does all the work. But an instant's thought shows that Afghanistan is being, if anything, bombed out of the Stone Age.
data.author: Christopher Hitchens

data.quote: I think it's less common in France that a man at the age of 50 buys a Porsche and gets a young girlfriend.
data.author: Carine Roitfeld

data.quote: We're past the age of heroes and hero kings... Most of our lives are basically mundane and dull, and it's up to the writer to find ways to make them interesting.
data.author: John Updike

data.quote: We must all rise to the challenge to demonstrate that security and prosperity in the Internet age are not only compatible with liberty, they ultimately depend on it.
data.author: Rebecca MacKinnon

data.quote: I am lucky, I don't have aches and pains. I do Pilates regularly, which is a series of stretching exercises, and I recommend it to anyone of my age because the temptation is not to exercise when you get older. Well, you should.
data.author: Ian Mckellen

data.quote: Every comedian is furious. Age makes me angry. I'm unhappy at not being able to open packages anymore. I'm angry that libraries have gone. I hate children on planes. I'm very shallow, so they tend to be little things. To be honest, I think I was probably angry the day I was born, you know, about diapers or something.
data.author: Joan Rivers

data.quote: At age nine, I got a paper route. Sixty-six papers had to be delivered to sixty-six families every day. I also had to collect thirty cents a week from each customer. I owed the paper twenty cents per customer per week, and got to keep the rest. When I didn't collect, the balance came out of my profit. My average income was six dollars a week.
data.author: Lou Holtz

data.quote: At a young age, I was interested in comic books, which was really how I learnt to read. The name Cage came from a comic book character called Power Man.
data.author: Nicolas Cage

data.quote: It were a real increase of human happiness, could all young men from the age of nineteen be covered under barrels, or rendered otherwise invisible; and there left to follow their lawful studies and callings, till they emerged, sadder and wiser, at the age of twenty-five.
data.author: Thomas Carlyle

data.quote: I think it is absolutely crazy in this day and age that I have to go through a trial and error method to see if my child is allergic to an antibiotic or peanuts. I should just know.
data.author: Anne Wojcicki

data.quote: I never was that boy who loved gangster films, but when I was growing up, I was obsessed with the detective Dick Tracy. It was one of my favourite movies as a kid, and he really inspired me. I would have loved to be part of that golden age of Hollywood in the 1940s. It made me want to become an actor.
data.author: Ryan Gosling

data.quote: With pop music, the format dictates the form to a big degree. Just think of the pop single. It has endured as a form even in the download age because bands conform to a strict format, and work, often very productively, within the parameters.
data.author: David Byrne

data.quote: This is the strange thing: Dancers don't age.
data.author: Twyla Tharp

data.quote: Unfortunately, in some parts of the country, some kids are taught at an early age that being different is somehow bad or wrong or worthy of ridicule.
data.author: Matt Bomer

data.quote: Unlike painting, sculpture, or music, typefaces must be useful to someone. Fortunately for designers, the digital age has produced new problems to solve - developing typefaces that work on mobile phones, for one - and enabled better solutions to old problems.
data.author: Virginia Postrel

data.quote: To be told that one can be dependent on one's parents until age 26 should strike a young person who wants to grow up as demeaning, not as something to celebrate.
data.author: Dennis Prager

data.quote: Human society has dense borders - economic, religious and cultural - inculcated from an early age. We hate change.
data.author: Alejandro Jodorowsky

data.quote: Most things in my life I had before leaving home. Values, support, great family. I was shaped at an early age. A musician playing guitar, I wanted to be a folk singer.
data.author: Sissy Spacek

data.quote: I think we live in an age of increasing mediocrity.
data.author: Dick Cavett

data.quote: Jesus is the politics of the new age He is about the establishment of a kingdom He is the one who has created a new time that gives us the time not only to care for the poor but to be poor. Jesus is the one who makes it possible to be nonviolent in a violent world.
data.author: Stanley Hauerwas

data.quote: Age shouldn't affect you. It's just like the size of your shoes - they don't determine how you live your life! You're either marvellous or you're boring, regardless of your age.
data.author: Morrissey

data.quote: No lying knight or lying priest ever prospered in any age, but especially not in the dark ones. Men prospered then only in following an openly declared purpose, and preaching candidly beloved and trusted creeds.
data.author: John Ruskin

data.quote: You get to a certain age and you can't judge yourself on your dad or your parents.
data.author: Ellie Goulding

data.quote: Every age has its own poetry; in every age the circumstances of history choose a nation, a race, a class to take up the torch by creating situations that can be expressed or transcended only through poetry.
data.author: Jean-Paul Sartre

data.quote: And I'm afraid, in this day and age, trust, which I count so, you know, I love loyalty. I love trust.
data.author: Elton John
